Harrison is preparing maps and reports on a Work Plan for thé Little Falling River Water shed, the latest development in one of four watershed project now under consideration in Ap pomattox County. The proposed Little Falling River Watershed is located in southside Appomattox County ly ing, generally, between state routes 727 and 604. It encom passes more than 6,000 acres in this county and 24,000 acres in adjoining Campbell County. What Is a Watershed? Harrison defines a watershed as an area of land drained by a given stream of water. In the case of Appomattox county wat ersheds, the streams involved are oreeks which ultimately drain into either the Appomattox or the James River. Ruritans Given Credit He gives much credit to the Ruritan organizations of Pamp- lin. Evergreen and Oakville, for generating interest in watershed organizations within their separ ate areas. The four watersheds presently under consideration Include Little Falling River, Cub Creek, Vaug han Creek, and Wreck Island Creek. A watershed organization 4 b cooperative among landowners involved who give their permis sion for dams, stream channel work, and other water régula tion procedures. The entire watershed program, Harrison explained, is an at tempt, among other things, to bring back into use bottom land that has been abandoned.
